metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14041 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function inbin/jp2/convert.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0. The vulnerability causes anout-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possiblyremote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
